contents.item: And now that its ruby eyes are set into the gold, you cannot see their tear-shape, so they seem to be laughing rather than crying. It is a constant reminder to me of the human ability to create something beautiful even when things are at the darkest.

contents.item: They knew, though, she would not suffer as they had suffered. She was perfect. They were scarred.

contents.item: The world needs more beautiful things.
Beauty is one of the strangest things. It never comes without the pain. But it always comes...eventually.
beneath the pain of your fears, wild and ready, lives your truth, the essence of your singular beauty, hoping, waiting for you to set it free.

Some rumors said she was a demon from another world. Other rumors said she was death incarnate, someone to remind us of our misdeeds. But no one had said how beautiful she was. No one had mentioned her eyes. The ones that showed color only for a second. A hint of beauty in absolute blackness.
Every seed dies before It grows.

You may have fallen down, but you can get back up again. You may have doors shut, but new doors will open for you. You may have been lied on, but the truth will come to the light. You may have been hurt, but the pain will pass. You are a survivor. You have a history of surviving.
We should always hope and expect to see a brand new day filled with hope, love and joy.
The death of a beautiful woman is, unquestionably, the most poetical topic in the world.
Whatever can die is beautiful — more beautiful than a unicorn, who lives forever, and who is the most beautiful creature in the world. Do you understand me?
contents.owner: Peter S. Beagle, The Last Unicorn

contents.item: Because beauty consits of it's own passing, just as we reach for it. It's the ephemeral configuration of things in the moment, when you can see both their movement and their death.

contents.item: When death speaks to me, it speaks only of the beauty of life.
Whatever is destroyed, the act of destruction does not vary much. Beauty if vapour from the pit of death.
